Title: Grounds Maintenance Contract
Description:
Hythe Town Council currently hold long term leases on a number of public open spaces within the Town. The Town Council are required to ensure that these spaces are kept in a clean and tidy condition. 

The Town Council place great value in the day-to-day management of these sites as the free resource that all residents can enjoy. Green Spaces are a vital part of our community infrastructure contributing in a variety of ways to the health and well-being of all that use them or even enjoy the simple visual amenity. 
Therefore, it is vital that the maintenance of these spaces is carried out to the highest standard and fully reflects the quality of service that the residents of Hythe pay for. 

Duties to include edging, grass cutting, weeding, planting trees, shrubs and seasonal bedding, pruning, small tree works, sports pitch maintenance and any other gardening tasks associated with grounds maintenance.

The Tender notice refers to an official letter provided by Hythe Town Council to complete large-scale services and deliver goods. 
Where the estimated value of a public contract exceeds £25,000 (net of VAT) Hythe Town Council will comply with Articles 109 and 114 of the 2015 Public Contracts Regulations in addition to section 135 of the 1972 Local Government Act.
Details of every open invitation to tender for contracts to provide goods and/or services which exceeds £25,000, and details of any contract, commissioned activity, purchase order, framework agreement and any other legally enforceable agreement with a value that exceeds £25,000 will be published on the Hythe Town Council website and on the Contracts Finder website.

Invitations and specifications will be sent to interested parties Please contact The Proper Officer, The Town Clerk in the first instance.
All sealed tenders must then be completed and returned by midnight 31 December 2021 and addressed to the Proper Officer:
The Town Clerk, Town Council Offices, Oaklands, 1 Stade Street, Hythe, Kent. CT20 6BG. The Council will reply in writing no later than 31 January 2022.

[Folkestone and Hythe District Council|Folkestone 
Kent|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: Holiday Activities and Food Programme (HAF) 2022
Description:
We have been successful in obtaining grant funding by the Department for Education (DfE) to roll out a local Healthy Activities and Food Programme for 2022; the purpose of the funding is to ensure that children and young people have access to food and activities over the school holiday periods where they are eligible for Free School Meals. Following receipt of funding, we have published an application opportunity for a range of organisations, activity providers, schools and community/voluntary sector organisations with relevant experience who will be able to offer free holiday provision including healthy food, enriching and physical activities to children and young people in Torbay during the following school holiday periods:

Easter for a minimum of four days, for four hours per day

Summer for a minimum of sixteen days, for four hours per day

Christmas for a minimum of four days, for four hours per day

The sessions over the school holiday periods will need to offer enriching activity (such as arts and crafts, educational activities etc.), a physical activity and a hot meal to children and young people in the 5-16 years age range. 

Please submit your responses back to the procurement team inbox: procurement.team@torbay.gov.uk
Additional Text:
In order to provide unrestricted, full, direct and free of charge access to the Tender Documents the Authority is providing the Documents in PDF format in the 'Opportunities' Area of the ProContract e-Tendering portal, at www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk

In order to access amendable versions of the Documents and to submit a response, Applicants must be registered as Suppliers on ProContract. Applicants should then register an interest in the opportunity and download the Documents for completion and submission.

Title: National Panel Review- Behavioural Insights
Description:
The Secretary of State has commissioned the National Child Safeguarding Practice Review Panel to carry out a national review into the circumstances leading up to the deaths of Arthur Labinjo-Hughes and Star Hobson. The national review is due to be published by the end of May 2022. As part of the review, the Panel will consider a range of broader evidence which 
will help inform its recommendations about how local and/or national safeguarding practice and systems should change to protect children in the future.
Behavioural Insights Ltd will support this broader evidence review by considering how behavioural science might inform decision-making and information sharing in high-risk contexts.

Title: Domestic Violence and Sexual Abuse Services
Description:
Southampton City Council is leading a joint procurement with the Office of the Police and Crime Commissioner for Hampshire and the Isle of Wight and the Hampshire, Southampton and Isle of Wight Clinical Commissioning Group to deliver community based domestic abuse support services to the community of Southampton and refuge services to the residents of Southampton and beyond. The requirement is for the provision of support services to victims of domestic violence or abuse and/or sexual violence or abuse.
The requirement is for the provision of support services to victims of domestic violence or abuse and/or sexual violence or abuse. The services will operate to: 
•	support medium risk victims at a time of crisis through residential (refuge) support and non-residential outreach support.  
•	support victims (and their children) to access safe accommodation including refuge if fleeing domestic violence.
•	support the individual with practical help, life-skills, and resettlement support to move on from an abusive partner.
•	provide therapeutic interventions as a part of a victim's recovery and support children and families to work through issues that may have affected them.
•	offer training and support to professionals to identify and refer victims and perpetrators.
•	offer preventative work to young people through educational programmes in schools addressing healthy relationships, recognising unhealthy behaviours, responding to abuse and seeking support.
•	deliver services to medium risk victims and their dependents in line with the local needs assessment and Domestic Violence strategy.

Full details of the service requirements are outlined in the Service Specification (Schedule 1 to the Terms & Conditions of Contract (the "Agreement") as detailed in the procurement documents. These may be accessed at http://www.southampton.gov.uk/business-licensing/supply-council/supply-portal.aspx
Attachments: Registration Information for Curtis Fitch July 2019 (3).pptx
Additional Text: The initial contract term is 5 years, which will expire on 30th June 2027. The Council has the option to extend the contract term further by individual periods not exceeding a total period of 24 months. The Council will also have the option to modify the contract by varying the maximum annual contract value by up to an additional £154,800 GBP per annum. This is to enable the future application of additional "New Burdens" funding for the purpose of additional provision of services to individuals living in "safe accommodation".

Title: Our Future Planet Summative Evaluation - AWARD
Description:
Our Future Planet is a free exhibition at the Science Museum in London open between May 2021 and September 2022. It explores the technologies being developed to remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. The exhibition is located in the 'Tomorrow's World' section of the Wellcome Wing on the ground floor of the museum and is not ticketed.
      
      The museum wishes to appoint a consultant to undertake a summative evaluation of the exhibition to understand how successful it was in meeting its aims and learning outcomes, as well as to explore visitors' response to the exhibition environment, content, interpretation and topic of the climate crisis. Lessons learned from the evaluation will be applied to future exhibitions and galleries developed by the Science Museum Group, particularly those focussing on contemporary science and the climate crisis.

Title: XYZ Machine Tools
Description:
XYZ Machine Tools are widely used through the Faculty of Engineering. We have a significant amount of skilled technicians who can run these, as they are widely used due to their flexibility. This inclusion of these machines, which provides a universal set of software, controls and ways of working within our teaching environment will enable many staff to effectively train and support our students with little to no training. We need to ensure consistency between our existing machines and the ones that we are bringing into our main teaching workshop.

XYZ Machine Tools are the only manufacturer of conventional and CNC controlled milling machines, this give us the flexibility to teach and operate in both modes without the need to do additional training to upskill the students.

Title: Diagnostic on the finance team and to provide business partnering training to the whole team.
Description: In 2018/19 we engaged Arcus consulting to do a diagnostic on the finance team and to provide business partnering training to the whole team. We are planning to continue this work in 2022/23 by rerunning the same diagnostic to confirm progress and have targeted training to bridge gaps identified. This includes 12 structured interviews with up to 12 business/academic leaders and up to 8 finance interviews, plus 2 half-day workshops. There would be continuity/reproducible issues with engaging other vendors since they would have different methodologies and would not be able to compare the performance and findings with the previous diagnostic in 2018/19.

NHS SBS acts in an Agency capacity for and on behalf of our customers (Approved Organisations) - existing and new. These comprise of NHS and Social Care organisations (whether acting individually, or on behalf of, or together as members of any consortia) along with any other public or private sector bodies which NHS SBS authorises to use the resulting Framework.

Title: The Provision of an Employee Assistance Programme and  Consular Wellbeing Service
Description:
The FCDO and FCDO Services (the Authority) are looking for an all-inclusive Employee Assistance Programme to cover officers and qualifying adult dependants who are posted to our Embassies and High Commissions overseas and for officers only who are based in the UK.

Briefly, the service should provide a confidential and efficient problem assessment and identification services to employees with personal issues that affect their performance at work. Referral of employees for assessment, support and assistance with case management and followup services.

The FCDO and FCDO Services operate in over c274 locations in 169 countries and territories overseas on all continents and it is essential that any successful bidder must be able to provide services across the network. We are seeking a provider who will be responsive and able to deploy in-country Counsellors when requested.

We expect this opportunity will be of interest to providers of Employee Assistance Programmes in not only the UK but also who have a worldwide network of affiliates who are able to provide the service across the FCDO/FCDO Services overseas network.

Also included in this requirement is the Wellbeing Supervision Programme (WSP), which provides the global network of Consular staff in public facing roles quarterly (and on demand where necessary) individual sessions with clinical supervisors to support their wellbeing. These sessions give consular staff the opportunity to regularly discuss the challenging and often distressing nature of their work, and are designed to help them acquire tools for resilience when managing the complex casework they face.

The Contracting Authority intends to use an e-tendering system for the procurement.

Organisation Name: NHS SOUTH, CENTRAL AND WEST COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT
Title: Provision of Lloyd George Record Digitisation Services - Lot 1 - Scanning Services to NHS North Central London CCG
Description:
The LG patient record comprises of the LG envelope and the contents, which is an important part of the patient's historical medical record. Each Lloyd George envelope has a broad range of detailed personal information stored inside and maintaining the security accuracy, availability and integrity of these legacy records is vital. The handling of these records needs particular care; the paper records can be up to 70 years old and some records are fragile and in a poor state, coupled with the fact the information they hold is vital and paramount for safe medical practice. The lack of continuity and resilience within the paper record poses a risk to the ongoing, continuity of person-centred care.. There is a legal requirement to keep the full patients record for a minimum of 10 years after the death of a patient.

There are four primary reasons for digitisation of Lloyd George records:
•	safer care for patients 
•	release of space within practices to provide additional consultation areas
•	access to the full patient record at the point of care
•	GP Contract commitments to digitise all Lloyd George patient records by March 2022.


This procurement followed a competitive tender using the NHS England and NHS Improvement Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) (OJEU Reference 2020/S 152-373617) which was established by the NHS England and NHS Improvement National Commercial and Procurement Hub as a route to awarding contracts for Lloyd George Record Digitisation Services. It is compliant with the public procurement regulations and public authority standing financial instructions. To note, the tender is caught in the scope of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 - Regulation 34: Dynamic Purchasing Systems.

NHS North Central London Clinical Commissioning Group have awarded a contract to deliver their Lloyd George Record Digitisation Services

This procurement process was facilitated by the NHS England National and Commercial Procurement Hub (commissioned from the SCW CSU) on behalf of the Commissioners.

Title: Request for Quotation for Evaluation of Suicide Prevention Transformation Projects
Description:
The Wave 4 Suicide Prevention Transformation Programme in Cambridgeshire and Peterborough runs between 2021 and 2024. It consists of the following 4 workstreams, delivered through a multiagency approach between the local authority and third sector partners:
1. Enhanced multi-agency Real-Time Suicide Surveillance (RTSS)
2. System wide training in Safetool safety planning and risk assessment
3. Communications and STOP Suicide Campaigns
4. Understanding and addressing self-harm in children and young people
We are seeking to employ an external evaluation service to evaluate the impact of the Wave 4 suicide transformation project in Cambridgeshire and Peterborough. This evaluation needs to consider the impact of each workstream as well as the overall impact of the programme and its multiagency approach. The objective of this evaluation is to inform our future suicide prevention work by determining the effectiveness of our chosen proposals in reducing suicide and improving the awareness of both healthcare professionals and the wider community in suicide prevention skills. In addition, learning can be shared with partners across the East of England region and wider to inform a wider suicide prevention approach nationally. In contrast, evaluation can also reveal areas of improvement that should be considered in future funding proposals.
Evaluation should be both qualitative and quantitative in nature, but there is no expectation of specific evaluation methods from the perspective of the Wave 4 steering group. We are keen to hear potential providers' perspectives on the most appropriate forms of evaluation, and we particularly encourage innovation in your approach. It is important to not only capture the immediate outcomes of our work, but also the long-term impacts that we are hoping to achieve, including behaviour change and greater suicide awareness in both professionals and members of the community.
Please note that this is a one year contract initially for up to £12,000, with an optional extension for 16 more months worth up to £24,000, depending on performance of the contract and external funding.

Title: NNC - Treasury Management Consultancy Service
Description:
Quotations are invited for the provision of treasury management consultancy    service to the Council Treasury.

The Treasury function provides a vital service to the Council as it is responsible for managing the Council's borrowing needs to support the capital programme. The Council's debt currently stands at £473m as at 31st December 2021.

The treasury function also manages the Council's investments which is made up of provisions, reserves and investment balances. This stood at £230m as at 31st December 2021.

This is a service for treasury management consultancy to a local authority and it is expected that the supplier will be able to cover all aspects of treasury management advice to the Council.  This includes training of officers and Council Members and provision of technical updates as necessary, including provision of guidance documents to assist with meeting report requirements to the Council and its Committees.

The Supplier will be expected to assist the treasury function to be able to produce the below six reports to the Council/sub committees of the Council annually:
i.	Treasury Management Strategy Statement (TMSS), Annual Investment Strategy (AIS) and Minimum Revenue Provision Policy (MRPP) in February;
ii.	Mid-year update on Treasury Management report in September;
iii.	Four quarterly treasury management updates for quarters ending March, June, September and December. 

Should you wish to take part in the selection process please complete this RFQ and return via e-mail to the Officer detailed in the table below no later than the Deadline for Submission of Bids of 23rd February 2022.

Title: ITT288 - Appointment for a Supplier of Cleaning & Janitorial Supplies  - AWARD
Description:
The University of Northampton is seeking an efficient, innovative, environmentally friendly, cost and financially competitive, high quality supplier of cleaning and janitorial supplies, conducted in an environmentally sound and sustainable manner. 
       
      The University of Northampton through this exercise seeks a supplier with proven track record of excellent service delivery, positive and satisfied customers experience achieved, capable of meeting its obligations with the scope of provided guidelines while provides measured quality in its services delivered.
       
      The University of Northampton has reaffirmed its commitment to combating climate change by pledging to becoming net zero carbon by 2030.  The institution's management team has endorsed the pledge to deliver net zero carbon by 2030, which means the University needs to eliminate or offset 5,000 tonnes of carbon emissions* by the end of the decade. 
      You can see the University's pledge on the https://www.oneplanetpledge.org/pledges .  As a result, University of Northampton is looking for a supplier that has the same commitment and places green initiative such as recycling cardboards, less packaging and sourcing green and eco-friendly products where possible at the heart of their operations. As such the cardboard packaging shall consist of >= 80% recycled material. Products carrying a relevant Type Eco label fulfilling the listed criteria will be deemed to comply.
      The requirements of the latest revisions of the relevant EU Eco label criteria shall be met in full by those products which fall within their scope.
      The Contractor shall be responsible for sourcing and delivery of the products supplies as defined and requested in the attached agreed and approved CORE/PROPOSAL list of items and The University is looking for one supplier to provide all services and not in lots. Products required are Cleaning Chemicals, Catering Chemicals, Paper Goods and Equipment
       
      UON Required Criteria/expectations for Paper Products/Cleaning Chemicals/Agents/Dispensers are as below:
      
      1. Paper products composition must consider requirements for minimum pipe slopes to sustain transport and disintegration of flushable products in small pipes in UON buildings and sewers to prevent blockages and environmental issues. The products need to be of such composition and quality to disintegrate rapidly in sewer systems.
      
      2. UON preference in sourcing of paper products is for products to be ecologically sourced, sustainable, socially responsible, environmentally friendly, and recyclable where possible and be cost effective. Particular attention will be paid to quality, the environment, and also contribution towards our Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) strategy. Paper products needs to be environmentally friendly & provide excellent quality, at an affordable price.
      
      3. Toilet/Hand Tissue dispensers either centre feed or folded must form part of the controlled one-sheet dispensing sys...

Title: NNC - North Northamptonshire Council Public Health Northamptonshire Dental Epidemiology Survey
Description:
North Northamptonshire Council (hereafter referred to as the 'Council') and on behalf of West Northamptonshire Council wishes to invite Tender Responses for the supply of services in respect of Public Health Northamptonshire Dental Epidemiology Survey.

To examine the oral health of specified population groups, as outlined in the guidance published by the Office of Health Improvement and Disparities (OHID) - formerly known Public Health England (PHE). The provider will use caries diagnostic criteria and examination techniques based on those agreed by the British Association for the Study of Community Dentistry (BASCD) , for caries prevalence surveys and using sampling procedures described in BASCD guidance on sampling for surveys of Child Dental Health.

The survey population is defined as per the National Dental Epidemiology programme Protocol and associated documents. The Provider will complete the minimum sample size as set out in the National Protocol. In Northamptonshire, the minimum sample size will be applied to both North and West Northamptonshire Council's. Additional to this, extended sampling will be required for each of the 7 locality areas: Corby, Kettering, East Northamptonshire, Wellingborough, Northampton, Daventry and South Northamptonshire.

Contract Opportunity Advertised https://www.contractsfinder.service.gov.uk/Notice/f2c5cc14-aae4-471d-987e-bc044fcb5688

The contract award is made to Triple P for provision of IT Mental Health Software Support Services, online parenting programme software application across Mid and South Essex.

This contract award notice will replace the previous notice which was published in March 2022, and any previous versions. Title: Proof of Concept CRA Bulk Data
Description:
HMRC (the Buyer) is the UK's tax and customs authority, collecting £639bn of tax revenue in 2019 to 2020.  Revenue that pays for the UK's public services and helps families and individuals with targeted financial support. We do this by being impartial and increasingly efficient in our administration. 
	
The tax gap for Income Tax, National Insurance contributions and Capital Gains Tax (IT, NICs and CGT) was 3.5% in 2019 to 2020 at £12.6bn and represents the biggest share of the total tax gap by type of tax. The tax gap is the difference between the amount that should, in theory, be paid to HMRC and what is actually paid. Minimising the tax gap is key to ensuring a fair for all system of tax as well as ensuring that public services can be maintained to an optimum standard.
CRA data is sought to address a range of individual and tax risks including:
	Under-declaration of income 
	Non-disclosure 
	Mitigating against other fraud related activity.

Title: Fencing and Boundary Systems & Repair of Boundary Masonry
Description:
Supply and installation of Fencing and Boundary Systems and repair of Boundary Masonry

The scope of works under this contract includes the supply and installation of various types of pressure treated timber Fencing and Boundary Works.

Bromford is responsible for maintaining homes and schemes across its four localities. Fencing and Boundary projects are often identified by Bromfords Repairs Managers. If a job is too big or too specialist for our in-house responsive repairs teams it gets referred to planned maintenance.

The Fencing and Boundary programme is aligned with the four localities / areas, so that delivery and reporting can be administered at a local level.

The information below breaks down what materials were used on the fencing and boundary programme last year based on budget spend.
Scope of Work % of Spend during 20/21
Fencing / Gates 80%
Galvanized Steel Fencing / Gates 5%
Masonry Walls 12%
Dry Stone Walls 3%

Bromford also receive work referrals; sometimes in year referrals need to be prioritised immediately as they might pose a health and safety risk to our customers and/or the general public.

In addition to the fencing and boundary programme work; contractors may be required to provide quotes for estate improvements and major repairs. In the past these jobs have included:

• Erecting Bin Stores
• Putting up signage
• Small hard landscaping jobs
• Re-pointing brickwork
• Installing drainage
• Turfing

Title: SC21053 Adult Social Care - Technology Enabled Care Build and Test
Description:
Kent County Council are looking to commission a provider to support a build and test pilot for Technology Enabled Care.

Making a Difference Every Day' is KCC's innovative approach for Adult Social Care.  We are  taking a bold, exciting approach so that together we can drive consistent, high quality, person-centred and innovative support to those that need it.  Technology Enables Care is key to the success of this new approach and  is critical to the Authority's vision for the social care and health landscape in Kent to harness the positive impact digital technology can have to enable independent living and optimise a person's outcomes whilst reducing the demand for care and support.

For a period of 12 months, the build and test model will operate across a proposed three of KCC's 12 districts. The learning and data captured will help inform a Kent wide digital solution.

Using a restricted procedure, KCC is seeking to appoint an agnostic technology provider where different types of technology can best test with real life assessments. The chosen provider will be required to collate data and work with a network of internal Digital Facilitators and Digital Champions to build a specification that will be used to inform sourcing a longer-term solution.

In the first instance Providers interested in this opportunity review the enclosed Specification and if appropriate should express their interest via the Kent Business Portal by 12th November 2021.  KCC is particularly interested in those Providers who can demonstrate their experience with supporting other Local Authorities. 

Our current timeline is as follows:

Call for Competition and SSQ issued to suppliers	23rd September 2021
Deadline for suppliers' questions	10th November 2021
KCC response to suppliers' questions	11th November 2021
SSQ returned by suppliers	12 November 2021
Evaluation and tender list approval	24th November 2021
ITT dispatch	25th November 2021
Tender return	6th January 2021
Tender evaluation and clarification	26th January 2022
Complete evaluation report	27th January 2022
Issue award letter	3rd February 2022
Standstill period complete 	17th February 2022
Contract award	18th February 2022
Start on Site	21st February 2022
Anticipated contract duration - 1 year	20th February 2023

Please express your interest in this opportunity on the Kent Business Portal.  Interested Providers are also asked to direct any questions via the Portal.

Title: 2122-0117 Cleaning at Copenhagen and Vittoria Primary Schools
Description:
Islington Council acting on behalf of Copenhagen and Vittoria Primary Schools invites suitable expressions of interest from suppliers for cleaning services to be provided at Copenhagen Primary School and Vittoria Primary School.
Copenhagen and Vittoria Primary Schools are part of the Islington Futures Federation. Both schools are based in North London, in the London borough of Islington. We are intending to appoint up to two contractors to provide cleaning services for both schools from January 2022.  The schools are local authority maintained one form entry schools.
We are inviting companies to tender for the cleaning contract at one or both schools. Bidders may apply for one or more lots. Each lot will be awarded to one contractor. A single contractor may be awarded one or more lots. If a single contractor is awarded more than one lot, a single contract may be issued combining lots.

      For this project, Dudley MBC has adopted Constructionline to streamline the procurement and assessment of contractors applying for this opportunity; https://www.constructionline.co.uk/
      
      If you are already a member of Constructionline at Silver Membership or above and following sections are verified on your profile C1 - Company Information, C2 - Financial and Insurance Information, C3 - Business and Professional Standing, C4 - Health and Safety, you can provide us with your registration number, and then you only need to answer the Optional Questions (O1 - O3) in section 4.2 and the Quality Questions located in section 4.5.

Title: GB-Telford: Indoor Sports & Leisure Strategy
Description:
Telford & Wrekin Council is seeking to appoint suitably qualified and experienced Consultant(s) to produce a new Indoor Sports & Leisure Strategy for the borough for the period 2022 to 2032. 
      
      It is 15 years since the current strategy (Leisure Facilities Framework 2007) was published and despite the unforeseen changes and financial challenges faced by Local Authorities, many of its key recommendations have been delivered. Current Council priorities, local drivers and the wider national sport and physical activity context have moved on and the need therefore exists to develop a new strategy for the borough. 
      
      The new strategy will provide a framework to ensure that the Council's indoor sports and leisure provision is able to further increase community physical activity levels, continue to meet current and future demands, contribute to the Council's commitment to 'Protect, Care and Invest' and to ensure every child, young person and adult lives well in their community. It will sit alongside the Outdoor Recreation Facilities Strategy to provide a robust assessment of need and evidence base for future sports and leisure planning, investment and policy decision making and be used to inform the Local Plan review.
Additional Text:
The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.

Title: Approved list for the Provision of Bikeability Training in Buckinghamshire
Description:
The Department for Transport (DfT) funds Bikeability cycle training for schools. The Bikeability Trust distributes this funding across England to local authorities. Bikeability is today's cycle training programme. It's about gaining practical skills and understanding how to cycle on today's roads. Bikeability training comes in a variety of modules which help provide skills and confidence in cycling.

In order to support the delivery of cycle training within the county Buckinghamshire Council (BC) is seeking Cycle Training Providers to deliver the training modules associated with any DfT funding grant BC should receive. Please note that any contracts awarded under this agreement from 1st April 2022 will be subject to the availability of funding received from the DfT.

The approved list will be based upon set geographical areas covering the various training modules available. The approved list will be in place from 1st April 2022 to 31st March 2025. All applications must be returned via the Buckinghamshire Business Portal. The tender return date is midday on Friday 21st January 2022. . Applications received after this time and date will not be accepted.

Title: Night Marshals and Street Angels Service
Description:
The Night Marshal Service is required to ensure that specific areas of Wakefield City Centre are patrolled on an evening identifying potential hotspots and diffusing situations before they escalate. The service generally operates on a Friday and Saturday evening between the hours of 22:30 and 05:30. The service which is run by the Council operates in partnership with West Yorkshire Police. 

The scheme has been operating successfully within Wakefield Central since 2007 and has been delivered throughout this time by an external contractor. The scheme is now embedded within the nighttime economy within the city centre and continues to deliver a range of benefits including: a reduction of crime in the Westgate area, a greater sense of safety for visitors, increased support to taxi drivers and licensees and a reduction in the amount of unofficial flyering through the monitoring of literature.  

The Authority is conducting this procurement process under the "Light Touch" regime of Regulations 74 to 77 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102) (the "PCR 2015").This procurement exercise will therefore be run in accordance with the PCR 2015 as they apply to "Light Touch" services. The Authority is following a process similar to the Open Procedure under the Regulation 27 of the PCR 2015.

Title: ITT - Learning Management System
Description:
The National Physical Laboratory [NPL] requirement is for Learning Management System [LMS].

The purpose is to move away from the current decentralised (four separate systems for HR, IT, H&S and L&D Training) and fragmented LMS and to replace all existing systems for all the functions/departments with a new centralised cloud-based Learning Management System.

Goals:
- Platform to allow a more comprehensive and improved training to meet the training needs of the organisation.
- Fulfil compliance obligations - Provide a capability to track and report training status. Manage data and information as a secure, valued and trusted asset.
- Create a modern digital learning environment - Aligning with Digital and IT strategy, simplifying data and information sharing.
- Transition training from existing platforms to the new platform where appropriate.
- Manage and improve quality of training - ability to provide professional training quickly, tools to enable staff to build training.

NPL is seeking to appoint an agency for a 3 year period, with the option for NPL to extend the contract for up to two years, to be exercised as one year periods and confirmed in the last month of the third and fourth years as applicable. NPL shall be entitled to terminate the contract after 11 months on giving 30 calendar day's written notice to the agency if, in NPL's sole opinion, the agency has not performed to a satisfactory standard.

This is a 2-stage awarding procedure. 80% score is available in stage 1 when responding to the tender (criteria in section 5 of this document) on the bravo e-tendering portal. A further 20% is available in stage 2, in which the top three scoring bids from stage 1 will be invited to complete a demo task. The scores from stage 1 and 2 will then be summed to produce a final awarding decision.

Title: Westgate Leisure Centre Decarbonisation Installation Contractor
Description:
Chichester District Council (CDC) has appointed a lead contractor for the decarbonisation of Westgate leisure centre, as part of a Direct award call-off from Portsmouth City Council's 'Combined Heat & Power Engine - Multi Contractor Framework Agreement'.  Chichester District Council received a £1.35m grant from the Public Sector Decarbonisation Scheme for the installation of decarbonisation technologies at Westgate Leisure Centre, Chichester. The leisure centre includes a swimming pool, fitness gym, exercise studios, 6 court sports hall, health suite and café. It has a total useful floor area of 6,400 sq. m. It was constructed in the 1980s and the health suite was added in 1999. The centre is run by tenant Everyone Active.

Chichester District Council is implementing a number of renewable energy technologies and energy efficiency measures to decarbonise and reduce the site's reliance on fossil fuels. These technologies and measures include: rooftop solar PV, rooftop solar thermal, air source heat pump (ASHP), CHP (Combined Heat & Power) unit optimisation, energy monitoring equipment and software, and an administrative request to the Distribution Network Operator. 

The proposed system will deliver:

1.	The annual financial savings of the project from energy savings must be 120% or greater than the total annual O&M costs
2.	The measures used to reduce these emissions in aggregate do not exceed a cost of £500 / tCO2e LT saved. 
3.	The project must be delivered on budget (as proposed by the supplier)
4.	Any defects must be addressed within 6 months of practical completion

Title: ITT for the Provision of Extra Care Services at Mora Burnet House (MBH)
Description:
The London Borough of Camden is seeking to award a contract for the provision of extra care services at Mora Burnet House. 
Mora Burnet House, a property owned by Origin Housing Management Services for the scheme, which is a 35-unit extra care sheltered housing scheme located in Swiss Cottage. 
The scheme will offer an alternative to residential care for older people, through supporting older vulnerable people living in their own tenancies in a dedicated building in order to maintain and develop their independent living skills, maintain their tenancies, link them into appropriate services and provide care and support. The importance of tenants' opportunities to contribute to the life of the scheme and all associated decisions will be central to the ethos for the service. 
The scheme will provide high quality care and support for vulnerable older people with multiple needs, including varying degrees of physical frailty, learning disabilities, mental health needs including dementia, or a combination of these. It is anticipated that the number of tenants with dementia accessing the service will increase over time. 
The scheme will provide care for people from Camden's wide range of Black, Minority and Ethnic (BME) communities. The service will be accessible, appropriate and welcoming for people of different religions and cultural backgrounds and will be proactive in developing a service that recognises and values diversity. 
The overarching philosophy will be to provide a home for life environment.

Title: Dover Maritime Rescue Coordination Centre (MRCC) Office Refurbishment and Infrastructure Works
Description:
The site at Dover is a critical operational location to for the Maritime and Coastguard Agency. Maritime Rescue Coordination Centre Dover and the team who work from the location deliver the six coastguard missions. The site is also the location where the Maritime and Coastguard Agency delivers its mandated Vessel Traffic Services for the Dover Strait and the Thames approaches.

The Operational areas require refurbishment to support a new layout and additional desks in both the Operations Room and a new Vessel Traffic Services area.

In addition, the following works are also required to improve the overall resilience of the site:

- Resilient power - Uninterruptable Power Supply to support all identified operational areas.
- Electrical switchgear and Uninterruptable Power Supply Rooms - preventative works to protect from flooding, corrosion, and loss of power.
- Exposed infrastructure - protection/replacement of exposed plant / assets.

The Contractor will take on Design responsibility for the works, acting as Principal Designer and as the Principal Contractor - (Construction Design & Management Regulations 2015).

The form of contract will be the NEC3 Engineering and Construction Contract Main Option A - Lump Sum with Activity Schedule

To bid for this opportunity, potential suppliers must register on the Department for Transport Procurement Portal (Jaggaer) and navigate to ITT number 733.

https://dft.app.jaggaer.com

Please note the estimated Contract Value is Inclusive of VAT

Organisation Name: Cambridgeshire County Council Insurance on behalf of Norwich City Council
Title: 21050: Norwich City Council Leasehold Housing Property Material Damage Insurance
Description:
Norwich City Council (The "Authority") wishes to invite tenders for the supply of services works in respect of Norwich City Council Leasehold Housing Material Damage Insurance as detailed within the tender documentation. 

The estimated total value of the contracts of the life of the agreements is estimated to be between £1,000,000 and £1,500,000.  This contract value estimation is provided for guidance only and the final values will be determined by the market and bids received.

Arthur J. Gallagher Insurance Brokers has been selected to assist the Insurance Service in the tender following a break of the existing Long Term Agreement which has triggered this tender process,

Please note that this does not stop other entities of Arthur J. Gallagher Ltd bidding for the contract detailed in this notice.

orwich City Council has a large-retained housing portfolio comprising approximately 17,700 units spread around the administrative boundary of Norwich City.

There are 3,230 properties that have been purchased on a leasehold arrangement by residents under the right to buy legislation conferred within the Housing Act.  These comprise mostly flats.  A full schedule of properties is provided within this tender document.

The properties are currently insured under the Council's insurance programme with cover being provided by the current provider who are leaving the market, hence the reason for this tender process.  This tender is separate from the Council's main programme and set to stand alone and completely separate from the remainder of the Council's insurance arrangements.

This tender is separate from the Council's main programme and set to stand alone and completely separate from the remainder of the Council's insurance arrangements.

The successful contractor will also be required to undertake ground contamination testing prior to demolition and again upon completion, as well as dilapidation surveys to surrounding area and properties (externally and selected properties internally).

Organisation Name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust
Title: Digital Dictation Service Led by Speech Recognition Software
Description:
The purpose of this contract is to deliver digital dictation service led via speech recognition software and ensure correspondence / records are produced in a more efficient manner. 

Currently there are two systems being used throughout the organisation and this contract award is to replace a current speech recognition contract only. 

Within the trust services mainly dictate correspondence or meetings and recently there has been an increased demand for voice recognition led software to offer real-time transcription for prompt completion of transcription. Currently clinicians are able to speak into a headset and immediately see the information dictated captured in text format directly into the required templates. 
KCHFT are looking to procure a solution which meets this demand via the NHS SBS Framework for Digital Dictation, Speech Recognition & Outsourced Transcription. 

Under the framework Criteria KCHFT is inviting all eligible suppliers to provide an ITQ response with pricing to meet the specification which includes the localised demand requirements.

Title: Perpetrator Programme Standards
Description:
1.1	There is a requirement to fund an organisation to develop a set of principles and a corresponding standards framework document that sets out the minimum expectation for services, interventions and programmes delivered to perpetrators of domestic abuse. 
1.2	The primary target audience will be those who commission and those who devise and run services, interventions and programmes for domestic abuse perpetrators.
1.3	The principles and standards should be in line with the Government's position on what constitutes domestic abuse as defined in Part 1 of the Domestic Abuse Act 2021, and the Domestic Abuse Statutory Guidance (when published) and should recognise, that whilst anyone can be a victim of domestic abuse, it is women who are disproportionally affected.

Title: UTC / SCOOT Hosted Software as a Service
Description:
UTC / SCOOT Hosted Software as a Service
Swindon Borough Council invites expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced service providers for the provision of UTC / SCOOT Hosted Software as a Service

The procurement of new Hosted UTC/SCOOT system to replace the existing local hosted UTC/SCOOT system used by Swindon. The system will be used for SCOOT traffic signal control, remote monitoring of faults and collection of network data

The initial contract term will be for 3 years with an option to extend for a further 2 periods of 12 months for a potential total contract term of 5 years as stated in the RFQ documents. Estimated contract spend is £80,000 across the initial 5 year contract term.

Full details relating to the Services are provided in the RFQ documents.

To participate, Suppliers will need to Register as a Supplier with ProContract, www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk, then Register an Interest before obtaining access to the tender documents. In the event of difficulties registering as a supplier, please refer to the System Administrator Proactis support team ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com

RFQ clarifications to be submitted in writing via Messaging in ProContract tender portal, including the project reference and title clearly in the Subject title, by 22/12/2021 14:00 hrs UK Local time. The Council's responses to these clarification questions will be issued periodically via Messaging in ProContract tender portal.

RFQ Responses are required to be submitted no later than 17 January 2022 14:00 hrs UK Local time via ProContract tender portal - https://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk/

Title: Provision of Blue Badge, Freedom Pass and Taxi Card Service
Description:
The London Borough of Bexley is seeking a provider to deliver a service for three concessionary travel schemes: Blue Badge parking, Disabled Person's Freedom Pass and Taxi-card applications. 
      The aim of this contract is to help people with severe mobility problems caused by visible and non-visible ('hidden') disabilities to access goods and services, by allowing them to park close to their destination, travel free on London's public transport, and in licensed taxis at subsidised rates.
      
      The service outcomes required are:
      •fair and consistent treatment of Blue Badge, Freedom Pass and Taxi - card applicants
      •customer-friendly and clear
      •timely and cost-efficient
      •resistant to abuse
      To facilitate these outcomes, a case management system will be needed that takes advantage of digital opportunities allowing the pathway for automatically eligible clients to be completed in a seamless and timely manner. For non-automatic eligibility the intervention of a mobility expert maybe required

Title: NNC- Development of an Access Strategy and Masterplan through to Detailed Technical Design of Cycle/Pedestrian Route between Rushden Lakes and Wellingborough Embankment - AWARD
Description:
The Council is seeking a suitably qualified and experienced landscape architect to develop an access strategy and masterplan, through to detailed technical design of a greenway route between Rushden Lakes and Wellingborough Embankment, (approximately five (5) kilometre linear route). The route passes through protected wetlands and a scheduled monument, and the land is a mix of privately owned land with existing rights of way permissions.
      
      A detailed design study is required, which will inform the delivery of an accessible cycle/pedestrian route between Rushden Lakes and Wellingborough Embankment, facilitating access to Chester House and extending the North Northamptonshire Greenway in the Nene Valley.
      
      Chester House Estate is a nationally significant heritage site and Scheduled Ancient Monument (SAM). In the surrounding area lies a Special Protected Area (SPA), the River Nene and other built and natural features.
      
      The Access Strategy will include a landscape character assessment to analyse and describe potential impacts of visitors, topographic and sensitivity. This will inform a feasibility and design options report recommending solutions for leisure and commuter access.
      
      The Rushden to Wellingborough study will specifically take place between Rushden Lakes and Wellingborough via Chester House Estate. (Google Plus Codes: All Wellingborough: 8926+2W through to 78RC+XQ via 78RW+MF, Grid references: SP929677 to SP902668 via SP919668).
      
      The scope of the work will involve:
      Preliminary meetings with North Northamptonshire Council and stakeholders including preparatory work and information sharing;
      A landscape character assessment;
      Proposal of access options;
      A technical detailed design study scoping a minimum of one (1) route; and
      A site masterplan showing agreed route.
      
      This contract must be concluded by no later than Wednesday,15th June 2022.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Sustrans|2 Cathedral Square, College Green, Bristol, United Kingdom, BS1 5DD|NONE||No|No]

Title: PQ0354 - Solarwinds software and support annual renewal (2022-23)  - AWARD
Description:
The Council requires a supplier for the provision of licences and support and maintenance services in relation to the products listed below.
      
      1) Orion Scalability Engines - 60231 - Legacy SolarWinds Additional Polling Engine for SolarWinds Unlimited Licenses (Standard Polling Throughput) - Annual Maintenance Renewal
      
      2) SolarWinds IP Address Manager IP4000 (up to 4096 IPs)-Annual Maintenance Renewal - 81235 - IPX (unlimited IPs)-Annual Maintenance Renewal (82341)
      
      3) Orion NCM - 60207 -  Legacy SolarWinds Network Configuration Manager DLX (unlimited nodes) - Annual Maintenance Renewal
      
      4) Engineer's Toolset - 60182 - SolarWinds Engineer's Toolset Per Seat License - Annual Maintenance Renewal
      
      5) Orion NPM - 60213 - Legacy SolarWinds Network Performance Monitor SLX (unlimited elements-Standard Polling Throughput) - Annual Maintenance Renewal
      
      6) Orion IP SLA Manager - 60193 - Legacy SolarWinds VoIP and Network Quality Manager IP SLA 50, IP Phone 3000 (up to 50 IP SLA source devices, 3000 IP phones) - Annual Maintenance Renewal
      
      7) SolarWinds UDT - 60386 - Legacy SolarWinds User Device Tracker UT5000 (up to 5000 ports) - Annual Maintenance Renewal
      
      8) Orion NTA - 60218- Legacy SolarWinds NetFlow Traffic Analyzer Module for SolarWinds Network Performance Monitor SLX - Annual Maintenance Renewal
      
      This contract will be for a period of twelve (12) months commencing 1st April 2022 until 31st March 2023.  
      
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register. You will then be sent details on how to log on which will enable you to download all relevant quotation documentation.  
      
      If you are unable to register with In-tend or have any questions or problems on how to use this web site please either email us at: cps@birmingham.gov.uk 
      
      Your completed quotation submission should be returned by noon on 21st February 2022 via the 'in-tend' system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

Title: Branded Tote Bags
Description: We are looking to procure 20,000 tote bags to support the reopening of the local economy successfully and safely on behalf of Sheffield City Council as part of the Welcome Back Fund (WBF) Project.  The project builds on the existing Reopening High Streets Safely Fund (RHSSF) and is funded by the England European Regional Development Fund as part of the European Structural and Investment Funds Growth Programme 2014-2020.     Background and Overview of the Project The project provides additional support measures to the local business community to enable safe trading in public places for businesses and customers. There is a particular focus on our high streets or 'District Centres' as well as other public places that are at the heart of towns and cities gearing up to reopen as safe, welcoming spaces.   Delivered by Sheffield City Council between the 1st July 2021 and 31st March 2022 the funding provided by Government through the European Regional Development Fund will deliver the following outputs.  • COVID-19 Public Information Campaign • COVID-19 Business Facing Campaign • High Streets with Temporary CV-19 Adaptations • Neighbourhood Shopping Areas with Temporary CV-19 Adaptations  The project will be delivered through the Business Sheffield, Marketing Sheffield and City Centre Management teams within the Council and has been split into three key strands of activity:

Title: Rough Sleeper Assertive Outreach and Support Service
Description:
The service concerns the delivery of a rough sleeper assertive outreach contract across the Dorset Council area.  The primary objectives of the contract are to achieve sustainable outcomes for rough sleepers and a reduction in numbers.

Assertive outreach engages pro-actively with rough sleepers encouraging moves into appropriate housing for safety, well-being and recovery. Routes off the street are supported by joint working and collaborative case planning. If someone refuses assistance or no route is identified, outreach teams are assertive - persistent and positive - continuing to engage and offer the right support until an offer is accepted or a suitable exit route found. 

We are seeking a provider with a track record of providing trauma informed and person-centred rough sleeper outreach services.

The awarded provider will be flexible and innovative in their approach to meet the needs of rough sleepers across the Dorset Council area, identifying people in rural locations where people tend to be more hidden, hostels and temporary accommodation absent, travel distances significant and public transport lacking, while ensuring cover is available for the inevitable peaks of rough sleepers in the summer months, particularly in coastal areas. 

The appointed contractor will maintain established outreach services and TUPE staff from the existing provider where applicable.

The contract period will be from 01 April 2022 to 31 March 2024, with two options to extend of 12 months each making a total potential contract period of 4 years.

To view all the tender details/documents and submit any bid, visit: www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk

Title: Temporary Ventilation & Air Quality Monitoring
Description:
EKFB is seeking to appoint a sub-contractor to supply and/or install the Temporary Ventilation and Air Quality Monitoring, to allow for a healthy and safe environment whilst constructing 3no twin-bore cut-and-cover tunnels. The tender will be considered in two lots: 
      
      Lot 1: Supply of all equipment and accessories for the temporary ventilation and air quality monitoring systems for the 3no Green Tunnels 
      
      Lot 2: Installation, maintenance and removal of the temporary ventilation and air quality monitoring systems in the 3no Green Tunnels 
      
      The temporary ventilation and air quality monitoring systems include, but are not limited to, fans, anemometers, gas detectors, smoke detectors, diesel particle matter detectors and volatile organic compounds detectors.
      
      The temporary ventilation and air quality monitoring systems should be in service from the commencement to the completion of the MWCC activities inside the tunnels. For that reason, the installation should be done in multiple visits, following the construction sequence of the tunnels. These visits should be short and efficient to ensure the disruption of the other activities is minimum.
      
      Anticipated Programme 
      
      Greatworth - from Jan 22 (in stages)
      Chipping Warden - from Sep 21 (in stages)
      Wendover - from Jul 22 (in stages)
       
       Through this expression of interest you will be vetted in accordance with the EKFB prequalification model - for further information visit https://www.competefor.com/EiffageKier/
      Following receipt of the questionnaire, we will create a short list by assessing capabilities, experience and availability of each supplier. Upon successful shortlisting you will be invited to tender from the EKFB e-Sourcing platform Market Dojo, EKFB will be using a balanced scorecard approach to its procurement activities - for further information visit the above website.
       
       Kerry Albrighton - Senior Buyer 
       Please see attached Document

Organisation Name: DVSA - Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency
Title: Air Brake Training
Description:
This contract is to deliver Air Brake Training for approximately 550 delegates over the initial contract period for Vehicle Examiners and Post Collision Examiners.

DVSA enforcement Vehicle Examiners are required to conduct examinations of large goods vehicles and public services vehicles. These checks can be part of a roadside inspection, fleet inspection or post collision investigation.

To be able to conduct a full technical inspection the Vehicle Examiners needs to have working knowledge of basic air brake systems as well as more advanced and current technology employed in large vehicle braking systems.

Post Collision Examiners need more in-depth knowledge to allow investigations following vehicle collisions. Post Collision Examiners are required to provide high standard detailed written reports with supporting oral evidence to the Police. These reports are often subjected to close review by defence councils and industry experts.
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Scotland,Wales

Title: Specialist Emergency Lifting Chairs for Care Homes in North East Essex
Description:
This is a Contract Award Notice to communicate a contract award made by NHS North East Essex Clinical Commissioning Group (the "CCG").

The contract award is made to Felgains Ltd for the provision of Specialist Emergency Lifting Chairs within 20 identified care homes across North East Essex, and to provide the appropriate I-Stumble training, equipment training, maintenance and repairs of the equipment during the contract term, and to work with the care homes to enable system reporting on effectiveness. 

This contract will aim to safeguard the lives of residents by ensuring they are lifted promptly after a fall, reduce avoidable hospital admission, keep residents at home and reduce impact on the emergency services and associated healthcare professionals.

This contract will run from 9th March 2022 until 8th March 2023, at a total contract value of £70,900 (plus VAT).

The CCG is publishing this Contract Award Notice in the Contracts Finder in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (as amended by The Public Procurement (Amendment etc.) (EU Exit) Regulations 2020) for spend above £25,000.
Contact Name: NHS North East Essex Clinical Commissioning Group

Title: St Anne's Square Planting 2022
Description:
Fylde Council are looking to appoint a contractor to carry out landscaping works at St Anne's Square in Lancashire. The works comprise of:
Making safe excavation works area through Chapter 8 Road Barriers.
Machine clear and dispose of existing bed vegetation.
Prepare beds for planting by removal of roots and debris.
Import, spread and level 10 ton high quality compost for bed levelling, improvement and plant hole backfilling.
Import and work in slow release fertiliser across all bed areas.
Supply plants in accordance with plant list.
Plant in accordance with location and design plans.
Import, spread and level high quality surface mulch to a depth of 100mm to all bed areas.
Power wash all work areas, perimeter pathways, and hard standings following the completion of planting works, to leave areas clean and accessible.
Undertake 6 week follow up watering regime, incorporating slow release fertiliser and ameliorants.

Further information is available by expressing interest to the opportunity at https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=3eac6f9e-b993-ec11-8112-005056b64545.

Title: 24 HOUR SHORT STAY, CARE AND ACCOMMODATION FOR ADULTS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES
Description:
The service that is currently being tendered for is for the provision of 24 hour, short stay care and accommodation for adults with Learning Disabilities.

The Council seeks to commission this service to commence 1st April 2022 for a period of 3 years with an option to extend on a rolling basis until 31st March 2027.

The service is designed to enable the 'cared for individual' to remain in a safe, stimulating and caring environment for periods of respite care. The service will also provide peace of mind for Carers that their loved ones take their respite in a secure environment in which they are comfortable, happy and well cared for.

The successful provider will be expected to provide minimum dedicated care hours each week regardless of bed occupancy. 

The service will provide 6 respite beds that will be commissioned on a block purchase basis, allowing for scheduled respite. In addition to the 6 block purchased beds there will be 1 additional emergency bed for emergency provision. This additional bed can only be accessed by means of a Social Worker/Care Manager or by the Emergency Duty Team (Out of Hours.)


Organisations wishing to register an interest and download the tender documentation, should apply via the NEPO Portal only.
www.procontract.due-north.com 

All completed documentation must be returned via the NEPO Portal Only and by no later than 2pm on Friday, 4th February 2022.

For guidance notes on how to register onto the NEPO Portal please follow link below: -  http://www.hartlepool.gov.uk/downloads/download/2576/guide_to_registering_as_a_new_supplier_on_the_nepo_portal

Title: RCN Sustainability in Nursing Practice Innovation Awards
Description:
The Royal College of Nursing Institute (RCNi) hosts yearly awards celebrating excellence amongst nurses in the UK, and the 2022 award will focus on sustainability and supporting the UK health system in reaching net zero emissions. Greener NHS (GNHS) seeks to provide funding of £18,500 to co-sponsor the 2022 awards. Through providing this funding, the NHS will:

• have a presence in the pre, during, and post event branding and comms, including logos on the RCN Nursing Awards website and a half page advert in an RCNi journal/ website of choice for two weeks.

• be involved in both stages of judging (both events held remotely).

• have an opportunity to shape the criteria of the awards, to ensure the highest number of quality entries are submitted. 

The RCNi have over 35 years' experience hosting these awards and are well versed in optimising outcomes for finalist and winners.

Title: Invitation to tender for Executive Recruitment
Description:
Somerset County Council and four local district councils (Sedgemoor, Mendip, South Somerset and Somerset West & Taunton) are progressing towards becoming a Single Unitary Authority. 

The Structural Change order that will create the legal basis for the new council in Somerset has been laid before Parliament. Once it approved it will be law that a new single unitary council - Somerset Council - will be responsible for providing both county and district council services from 1st April 2023.

Included within this Structural Change Order is the intention to use the county council as the corporate body for the unitary council - known as a "continuing authority". As such Somerset County Council is seeing responses to this request from Applicants to award a contract to attract applicants for the post of Chief Executive of the new Authority.

The site is currently used as an operational depot, consisting various warehouses, garages, an office building, a Victorian terrace house (and garden) and car parking. 

The Works will comprise the strip out and demolition of all existing buildings within the site boundary to include the adjacent residential dwelling otherwise known as "The Cottage". Title: Professional Nurse Advocate Programme - Literature Review
Description:
The Authority required a Supplier to undertake a literature review to identify research reports reporting on Professional Nurse Advocates (PNAs) and provide a synthesis of key findings and associated implications.

The aim of this literature review is to identify research reporting on Professional Nurse Advocates (PNAs), associated research on Professional Midwifery advocates and any studies on the key aspects of the a-equip model such as restorative clinical supervision, and provide a synthesis of key findings and potential recommendations.

Person/Supplier Specification:

- Contractor/s must have prior experience of report writing to a high standard on strategic level health related subjects

- Report to be completed within the writing guidelines set out by NHS England & Improvement

- The report must include the programmes agreed branding (will be provided) and comply with the overall NHS England Branding guidelines

- Have sufficient capacity to complete the task to the contractor's satisfaction within the timescales, duration of contract and within the agreed financial amount.

- Expenses will only be paid on exception and with prior agreement. The provider is expected to cover normal expenses in the agreed rate/contract value.

Title: Professional Nurse Advocate Programme - Evaluation
Description:
The Authority required a supplier to undertake an evaluation of the impact of the Professional Nurse Advocates (PNA) programme on the PNAs and wider impact of PNAs in a team with recommendations for improvements.

We would expect the following stages to be included in this work:

1. Document the baseline before the PNA programme
2. Evaluate the PNA model
3. Assess the usefulness of using one or all elements of the model and the perceived impact and outcomes
4. Restorative clinical supervision - evaluation specifically of the perceived benefits.

The evaluation specification details four separate work-packages. These are stand-alone packages, which have been presented here as options to allow choices for the supplier, other delivery options can be incorporated into the tender document. The potential for linkages and interdependencies between these work-packages has been described but is not exhaustive.

We would expect the research commission to include interviews and focus groups with individuals to see if different fields of practice have different experiences, and if the programme works better in some settings than others.

The evaluation will be theory-driven throughout; all evaluation activities will incorporate elements to develop and refine a programme theory. This process will explicate the role of programme implementation activities and describe assumptions about how these are intended to achieve specific intermediate and distal outcomes. The importance of context in determining the extent to which these assumptions contribute to expected changes will be incorporated into this programme theory.

Notice Identifier: CCS RM6187 Lot 5 Planning Inspectorate 17/02/1048 External Support for Inspector Recruitment Review
Title: CCS RM6187 Lot 5 Planning Inspectorate 17/02/1048 External Support for Inspector Recruitment Review
Description:
The Planning Inspectorate is looking for external expertise to help us review how we recruit Planning Inspectors, in particular:  
Undertake external market research to understand why people within the planning (and other land-use) profession do not apply to become Planning Inspectors.  This will help shape our approach to recruitment in future.  
Review our recruitment pack and communications to advise changes to attract a broader range of candidates.  
Advise on innovative ways to help us recruit (i.e. is our current approach of CV, test, and interview the most effective approach?).  
Review our recruitment process to ensure the process aligns with our Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy. 
We anticipate that the work shall take 22 days to complete but ask that suppliers propose whether that is realistic.  It is expected that the work is started in March 2022 with the remainder completed in April 2022. 
In addition to the above, the Planning Inspectorate reserves the right to change the contract for additional, similar packages of work related to recruitment of Inspectors or other employees.  If we decide to proceed with any contract changes, those will need to be agreed by both parties via a contract variation before any work begins.
 Please provide your written proposal using the 'proposal template' provided in Annex B, clearly setting out how you meet the evaluation criteria included in the Section 4.   
The proposal template includes a section for each of the criteria being evaluated.  In the template, please also declare any known or perceived conflicts of interest with any employees or contractors of the Planning Inspectorate.   
Where to send your written proposal Annex B and Pricing proposal Annex A 
Your written proposal and pricing proposal must be submitted to linda.paul@planninginspectorate.gov.uk no later than 16:00 on 25 February 2022.  Written proposals and pricing received after this deadline will not be accepted

Description:
The contract is for the operation of a recycling facility, requiring the operator:
• To discharge the COTC aspect of the Permit
• To manage the H&S aspects of the facility in accordance with existing and established procedures, with the assistance of the Council's H&S Advisors
• To coordinate Visitors to the facility
• To make the facility available from 7.00am to 5.30pm M-Fr (Sa/Su as required for service provision)
• To receive deliveries from the Council's recycling collection services
• To provide loading shovel and accredited operator.

• To coordinate and load onward haulage as necessary
• To undertake necessary inspections of facility with regard to the provisions of the Environmental Permit (e.g., materials, segregation, fire watch, dust suppression, etc.)
• To segregate materials to remove contamination and to avoid cross contamination of materials. Provide daily reporting on contamination
• To open up and secure the facility at the end of each working day
• To coordinate and facilitate regular periodic maintenance checks as required and record such inspections.

Title: Project Management Training (PRINCE2) - AWARD
Description:
Project Management Training (PRINCE2)
      
      The Council has a learning requirement for identified managers to be upskilled in Project Management PRINCE2 methodology. The managers identified are responsible for the delivery of both small and large-scale projects throughout the organisation. Given the variety of projects and range of existing knowledge and skills, a flexible approach to the training offer will be required in order meet the precise knowledge level requirement for the job role being carried out i.e. project manager, project support etc.
      
      As project officers within local government, it is imperative for these delegates not only to understand but to have the ability to apply the principles when managing projects and programmes.
      
      The Council uses PRINCE2 methodology for consistent Project Management and therefore the learning is to be based on PRINCE2 methodology.
      
      Essentially the Council would like to appoint an approved provider to deliver the PRINCE2 training programme at an introductory level, foundation, practitioner level and practical application level: 
      
      o One Day Introduction to Project Management Essentials 
      o PRINCE2 Foundation Qualification Course 
      o PRINCE2 Practitioner Qualification Course
      o Practical Application Workshop for PRINCE2
      o E-learning Access (as a standalone option for delegates not attending any of the courses above).
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to Quotation or other related documents.
      
      To submit a quotation you will be required to 'Opt In'.
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date: Tuesday 15 February 2022 at 15:00hrs

Title: (NU/1739) Supply of Emerson Cavitation Control System Upgrade
Description: The Emerson Cavitation Tunnel (ECT) was constructed in 1949 from a horizontal closed-circuit water flume that operated in Pelzerhaken, Germany. The flume was then brought to the UK by the Admiralty after World War II. Dr Arnold Emerson was appointed as the first superintendent and in 1980 after modernisation, the ECT was renamed in recognition of his 30-year contribution. Since 1980 the ECT has continued to see investment in its operating system and data acquisition. Laser Doppler Anemometry (LDA) and Particle Image Velocimeter (PIV) systems have enabled precise and non-disruptive measurements of water velocity to directly measure the boundary layer and turbulence in the flow. The ECT control system was last updated in 2008 by Cussons Technology Ltd. Since then, Cussons has gone into administration leaving the old and dated control system with no technical support. We are looking for the supply of a control system upgrade for the ECT. The scope of this contract is for the supply and delivery as detailed in the ITT to the University, with after-sales support and 12 months warranty and maintenance.

Title: English Heritage Email Services Provider Tender - AWARD
Description:
The provision of an email service provider is being led by Membership Marketing for membership retention, acquisition and CRM purposes. Other departments also currently use broadcast marketing; CRM and transactional emails to customers, including our online shop, holiday cottages, education, and travel trade; and their needs also need to be met.
      
      Our email marketing fits into a wider integrated campaign plan across the business (including direct mail, social media and content marketing, telemarketing and other offline comms) assisting us to achieve the following objectives: 
      
      o Encouraging use of membership.
      o Increase Member engagement.
      o Bringing in additional revenue e.g. donations.
      o Win back lapsed Members. 
      o Recruit new Members.
      o Increased site visits and attendance of events by Members and by visitors who have booked using SEE tickets or other non-Members.

Title: Planned & Reactive Maintenance Services for Heating, Ventilation & Air Conditioning
Description:
Buckinghamshire and Milton Keynes Fire Authority (BMKFA) (the contracting Authority) wish to appoint a single Service Provider to provide the complete HVAC services detailed in the specification of requirements for Buckinghamshire Fire and Rescue Service.  The Contracting Authority's service delivery is managed through its Headquarters facilities department, based at Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire, across 19 sites within the county of Buckinghamshire and Milton Keynes. The successful bidder will also be provided with access to bid for future capital project opportunities that may arise during the contract term, which fall within the area of service expertise contained within the specification.
The successful bidder will be required to provide a range of services to maintain the Authority's Pre-Planned maintenance services along with the Reactive maintenance services for all the HVAC requirements detailed within the Specification of Requirement.  Bidders will be expected to demonstrate experience of a combination of wet and dry HVAC systems across multiple sites, including HVAC systems fuelled by Gas, LPG or Heating oil (Kerosene)
Bidders are recommended to attend the 4 days of site visits, which will take place on the 6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th of December 2021. Full details of the four days of site visits are contained within the tender documents. 
The contract is expected to be awarded by February 2022 with a service commencement date of 01 April 2022.  The initial contract term is for 3 years with an option to extend a further 24 months.
The average annual value of the contract is estimated to be £67k, with an estimated total contract value of £335k for the possible full term of up to 5 years.  The annual value consists of pre planned maintenance and reactive maintenance. 
Bidders wishing to participate in this tender opportunity must register on the Authority's e-procurement portal to express an interest and access the tender documents, via the following link:

https://in-tendhost.co.uk/bucksfire/aspx/Home
